reviews.review_msg: If you don't have a coding background you're going to struggle even though she teaches introductory courses. Janice's slides are too information heavy and rather than explaining she just reads off the slides. Even if you do get the hang of coding, beware that she doesn't like any other coding style besides her own.
Janice was great, yes she might be a bit monotone, but she does explain things very slowly and is willing to repeat herself until everyone understands. Quizes add up to an easy mark, exams very fair.

Brian is a great prof for CMPT 102: he has good knowledge in Matlab and he is passionate in teaching it . I would say attending lectures is quite important for this course, as there are "to-tries'  for every lecture. It's a great opportunity since you code with ppl there to answer questions. It's an easy A if you do the practice in class.
Great Professor ! Very kind and helpful.

An approachable educator who definitely knows what he's teaching. His lecture slides are useful, though basic. So, you need to master the in class examples to complete the homework. Though he is decent at explaining things, I found the TA even more helpful than him. My only suggestion for Dr. Funt is that he boil down to simpler terms when teaching
Horrible prof, by far one of the worst people i have ever encountered. I hope he does not continue as a professor, at SFU.
Always willining to help. Sometimes confuses himself during lectures. Overall a relatively nice guy

he doesnt know what he is talking about and his hair is negatively affecting my ability to concentrate in his class this man should learn how to teach and if he continues to persue computer science he should learn how to use a computer

Dr Funt is a great prof, he spearheaded getting this course switched to Matlab which is way more useful for most people who have to take it.  He clearly wants the best for his students, and is very helpful.
 
 Assignments can be a little tricky, but they're interesting and instructive.  All the tests were very fair.
funt is a great prof. Just make sure you dont play on the computers during lecture! he does not like that. just listen and you'll be fine.
I love professor Funt. This class would be a lot harder if it wasn't taught in CSIL. Matlab was a way better language to learn than Java or C++. I thought I would hate it, but this class is awesome.

Dr. Funt is a very helpful,funny, caring teacher. He even me offered extra help outside the course content. One of the best professors I've had. A+ hands down. Very clear and reasonable in all testing and teaching aspects.
Not interesting/helpful/useful...that pretty much sums it up...maybe he's better at teaching courses in his "area of expertise" but he's a crummy first year course prof

This was my first cmpt class and I was terrified. Madooei teaches topics really well and as long as you pay attention to class you wont have many problems with the assignments. If you understand the assignments  the midterm and final should be no problem. Overall hes a great prof and always wants to help you.

The assignments are not related to what taught in the class.

Random marking on final group project.

Has no control over the TAs and their favoritism.
Condescending responses to questions in office hours. Would recommend you take this course with someone else.

Frequently digresses into unrelated topics during discussions, displays a tendency towards confusion and quick irritation, and consistently appears rushed in demeanor.

 I would advise against enrolling in his courses
I think he made the class ineteresting, with little jokes. And the notes were really good.
class is relatively easy. he gives very detailed notes. the assignments and exams are fair.
course is easy as hell. he explained it well.. but it was an easy course so hard to judge teaching ability.
